node.title: China critic forms new political party with young, diverse candidates ahead of federal election
node.alt: A young Uyghur woman looks at the camera smiling.
node.description: Five people, mostly in their twenties, are part of the "same political movement" and hope to run in the 2022 federal election under the banner of a new political party.Â
node.content:
["At just 21 years old, Adila Yarmuhammad believes she will be the youngest Muslim woman running in the 2022 federal election.\u00a0", "She aims to secure a seat in Australia's parliament, but she knows she's inexperienced.", "\"Even just running [for a seat] is enough, it's showing other women and younger girls that this is possible,\" she said.", "\"You don't really see a lot of women of colour in parliament, let alone a lot of Muslim women in parliament.\"", "The university student and human rights activist, an Adelaide-born Uyghur, wants a South Australian Senate seat.", "\"South Australia has always been male, white, dominated in terms of our politics and our parliament,\" she said.", "", "
Ms Yarmuhammad is one of the five candidates in the Drew Pavlou Democratic Alliance.(ABC: Dong Xing)
", "
Party born of Hong Kong activism\u00a0
", "Ms Yarmuhammad is one of five\u00a0mostly young\u00a0candidates brought together to run under the banner of a new political party, headed by 22-year-old Drew Pavlou.", "Mr Pavlou shot to media prominence in July 2019 when he organised, for the first time, a protest at the University of Queensland to support the Hong Kong pro-democracy movement.", "\"I held that one protest and then my life changed forever,\" he said.", "Mr Pavlou was assaulted by pro-Beijing students at the event, which was captured on camera.", "The video went viral and marked the beginning of Mr Pavlou's public activism against the Chinese Communist Party (CCP).", "Fast-forward two years and Mr Pavlou said the \"Drew Pavlou Democratic Alliance\" had\u00a0over 2,000 members, had\u00a0raised $27,000 in \"grassroots donations\" and was in the process of being formally registered with the Australian Electoral Commission.", "", "
Mr Pavlou says the party has a human rights focus, particularly issues relating to the Chinese Communist Party.(ABC: Dong Xing)
", "\"If we can't get on to the ballot paper as the democratic alliance,\" said Mr Pavlou, \"we would all run as independents but part of the same political movement and have similar branding.\"", "The alliance had a launch event at Hyde Park in Sydney today and has already courted further controversy in Queensland after a billboard company refused to run advertising from the alliance supporting the diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Winter Olympics.", "In terms of what the party stands for, Mr Pavlou said it was not one single issue.", "But the group has a focus on human rights, with an eye specifically on issues related to the Chinese Communist Party.", "\"Chinese Communist Party\u00a0interference, CCP authoritarianism, is part of a broader problem in politics where we are seeing a broader retreat of democracy and rise in authoritarianism,\" Mr Pavlou said.", "But he emphasised the alliance is \"not against the Chinese people\" and the party has the \"utmost respect for Chinese people\".", "Policies on Mr Pavlou's website include officially recognising China's treatment of Uyghur and Tibetan people as genocide, lifting the rate of Job Seeker, investing in high-speed rail and\u00a0sanctioning \"genocidal\" Chinese officials.", "The part-time student, who also works part-time in a lawyer's office, knows the odds are against his alliance \u2014 and him personally in his bid for a Queensland Senate seat \u2014 being elected to parliament.", "But Mr Pavlou is undeterred, telling the ABC he can always go and work in his dad's fruit shop if things \"crash and burn\".", "\"We are a breath of fresh air,\" he said.", "
Young candidates 'smart' and 'compassionate'
", "Another member of the alliance is 27-year-old Uyghur Australian Inty Elham, who is running for a seat in the House of Representatives, in the electorate of Sturt in South Australia.", "The chiropractor, also a human rights activist, runs her own health business.", "\"I want more representation in Australian politics\u00a0in terms of cultural diversity and I want more women in parliament, especially in light of recent events,\" Ms Elham said.", "", "
Inty Elham plans to run for a South Australian House of Representatives seat with the alliance(ABC: Dong Xing)
", "In Victoria, Hong Kong pro-democracy activist Max Mok, 21, will challenge Liberal Gladys Liu in the seat of Chisholm, a seat Ms Liu won by a handful of votes at the last election.", "Mr Mok said he used to be a student in that electorate\u00a0and his family has lived in Chisholm for a long time.", "\"We remember in Australia, before Chinese infiltration really happened,\" said Mr Mok.", "\"Right now, in some of the electorate, it's really hard for regular voters to pick and choose which party they want to vote for. We're trying to [be] the alternative.\"", "Finally, there's Kyinzom Dhongdue, who lives in Sydney, vying for a New South Wales Senate seat.", "Ms Dhongdue said she was the first Tibetan Australian to run for Australian Parliament.", "At 43-years-old, the professional human rights campaigner said she was conscious she was the eldest of the group but had\u00a0joined with the alliance because young people \"give me hope\".", "\"They are smart and they are compassionate and they know how to deal with all our crises of our time,\" Ms Dhongdue said.", "Ms Dhongdue, who has taken six months off work to participate in the campaign, was born in a Tibetan refugee camp in India\u00a0and came to Australia \"as a stateless person because China invaded my country\".", "\"I have dedicated my life to lobby the Australian government to put human rights before profit in our relationship with China,\" she said.", "\"I believe we are at a critical point in our relationship with China and it is important that our voices are heard.\""]
